docs.lead_paragraph: David Frazer is a member of the Schools Subcommittee of the Maplewood Citizens' Budget Advisory Committee. Here is a letter sent to South Orange and Maplewood Board of Education President Mark Gleason and Supt. Brian Osborne detailing the committee's recommendations for dealing with the district's 80.9 percent cut in state aid for 2010/2011. The Board of Education meets tonight at 7:30 p.m. at the District Meeting Room on Academy Street.

docs.lead_paragraph: The major health care vote has come and gone, a moment that seemed so far away, if not out of reach, just months ago.

headline.main: The Early Word: Health Care Landmark

docs.abstract: The battle for public opinion on health care continues anew.
docs.snippet: The battle for public opinion on health care continues anew.

docs.lead_paragraph: Congress Passes the Health Care Bill | California, where 25 percent of residents are uninsured, may have the most to gain from the passage on Sunday of the House bill that would overhaul the nation's health care system. The overhaul will, among other things, expand health care coverage for the poor and low-income and tighten controls on insurance companies will affect people differently depending on where one sits in the system. [The San Francisco Chronicle, The New York Times, HealthyCal]

docs.lead_paragraph: Today's idea: In a way, blogging isn't all that new, a historian says. Informal writing combining pithiness with provocation stirred up the politics of Renaissance Italy and prerevolutionary France. And in light of the Web, it deserves more study.

headline.main: The Resentment Zone: Losing Means-Tested Benefits

docs.abstract: The combined effect of taxes and phased-out benefits for those not far above the poverty line may account for Tea Party enthusiasm among the lower middle class, an economist writes.
